required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Value of Endoscopic Ultrasound Elastography for Differential Diagnosis of Gallbladder Polyp
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Value of Endoscopic Ultrasound Elastography for Differential Diagnosis of Gallbladder Polyp

brief_summary.textblock:
Gallbladder polyps are often detected incidentally by ultrasonography. The most of gallbladder polyps are non-neoplastic such as cholesterol polyps and do not need further treatments. However, neoplastic polyps, which need additional treatments to prevent malignancy, show the same appearance on ultrasound. Clinically, the differential diagnosis between cholesterol polyps and adenomatous polyps is very important for patient follow-up and treatment. However, differential diagnosis between these two conditions is difficult using conventional trans-abdominal ultrasound.
Endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) is less affected and disturbed by subcutaneous fat or intraabdominal air, so a clearer image of pancreatobiliary system can be obtained. In addition, EUS elastography is recently introduced, which can evaluate the stiffness of a target lesion and compare it with surrounding tissues (strain ratio). Several studies have been published that EUS elastography can help in the differential diagnosis of pancreatic solid lesions.
Although studies have been conducted to confirm the usefulness of elastography through transabdominal ultrasound of the gallbladder polyps, no prospective studies have been conducted to evaluate the usefulness of EUS elastography for gallbladder polyp. Therefore, with this prospective study, we would like to evaluate the diagnostic value of EUS elastography for differential diagnosis of gallbladder polyps.

primary_outcome.measure: Pathologic diagnosis of gallbladder polyp after cholecystectomy
primary_outcome.description: Pathologic diagnosis of gallbladder polyps or masses in cholecystectomy specimen

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within two years of starting the study
primary_outcome.description: Differences in strain ratio between non-neoplastic and neoplastic gallbladder polyps.

secondary_outcome.measure: Optimal cut-off valve of strain ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two years of starting the study
secondary_outcome.description: Optimal cut-off valve of strain ratio for differential diagnosis between cholesterol polyps and adenomatous polyps

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two years of starting the study
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value and diagnostic accuracy of EUS-elastography for diagnosis of cholesterol polyps.

clinical_study.condition: Gallbladder Polyps or Masses Greater Than 8-10 mm in Size

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have GB polyps and are recommended cholecystectomy due to large size of polyp (8-10 mm or larger).

criteria.textblock:
1. Inclusion Criteria:
1. Gallbladder polyp of 8-10mm or more in size confirmed by imaging tests
2. Must be 19 years old or older
3. With voluntary agreement to participate in the study after be informed about the necessity of EUS due to the clinical necessity
2. Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unable to confirm histological diagnosis (ex. Patients did not underwent cholecystectomy)
2. Younger than 18 year-old
3. Without agreement with this study or informed consent
